newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX gasoline ends higher on Venezuela outage.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX gasoline ends higher on Venezuela outage.

text.p: NYMEX gasoline prices ended higher Tuesday on news Petroleos de Venezuela's Amuay refinery suffered a partial outage, while heating oil prices declined on prospects of increasing supplies, traders said.
"The refinery supplies about 70,000 barrels per day of gasoline, so the effect of this problem (on supply) could be significant depending on how long this lasts," said a New York trader.
November gasoline settled up 1.20 cents at 69.12 cents a gallon while November heating oil ended off 0.18 cent at 73.45 cents a gallon.

A 108,000 barrel per day (bpd) catalytic cracker at Petroleos de Venezuela's (PdVSA) Amuay refinery went down on Sunday due to problems with an air compressor, a PdVSA spokesman said. The spokesman said the refining unit would be running again by week's end.

The rise in gasoline prices took November crude to a contract high of $26.10 a barrel at a time when crude is already at five-year highs. But, November crude closed off 17 cents a barrel to $25.75 as the November contract expired Tuesday and traders rolled positions into the December contract.

Heating oil prices fell on news Colonial Pipeline Co will make room on its 1.2 million bpd gasoline line to accommodate a surge in requests to ship distillates, especially heating oil, on its pipeline.
"The market is reacting to Colonial's maximizing distillate deliveries by using its gasoline line," said John Bradberry, vice president of risk and inventory management at Continental Ozark Inc.
The Colonial Pipeline extends from Houston to Linden, New Jersey, on the edge of New York Harbor and includes a 960,000 bpd distillate line.

Colonial said requests to ship more distillates on its pipeline increased following a meeting between U.S. Energy Department officials and oil company executives to discuss a spike in heating oil prices related to record low inventories.
-- Harry Milling, New York Energy Desk, 212-859-1761
